decks.notes: This Cradle Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck utilizes Gaea's Cradle and mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Ignoble Hierarch to generate large amounts of mana, while also controlling the board with cards like Wasteland and Endurance. Additionally, the deck includes toolbox creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Green Sun's Zenith to adapt to different situations. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and efficient mana usage.

The deck aims to quickly empty the entire library into the graveyard, utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill cards, while also using fast mana sources like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal. Once the library is emptied, the Thassa's Oracle is played to win the game instantly. With protection in the form of Pact of Negation and disruption with Duress and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to combo off as quickly and efficiently as possible, with the potential for explosive turn one wins.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and aggressive blue cards to control the game and quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining powerful artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal with disruptive cards like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while also building a strong board presence with creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional ramp and consistency for the key artifacts in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize artifacts, particularly Urza's Saga, in combination with creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Patchwork Automaton to create a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent with cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will. The inclusion of cards like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal allows for explosive starts and the ability to quickly generate mana for powerful plays.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw, while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage and gain control of the board. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provides additional card advantage and creature protection, while Leyline Binding helps to lock down opposing threats. Up the Beanstalk and Quantum Riddler offer ramp and card selection to ensure consistency in the deck's game plan. The inclusion of a diverse land base allows for flexibility in mana production and protection against various threats.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying early pressure with aggressive creatures. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's hand and counter their spells, alongside efficient removal like Fatal Push. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Stock Up to maintain resources. Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provide powerful threats to close out the game quickly. This Dimir Tempo deck aims to outmaneuver opponents with a combination of disruption and aggression to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing dredge mechanics to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards, such as Golgari Thug and Golgari Grave-Troll, while also using Lion's Eye Diamond for explosive mana generation. By using cards like Faithless Looting, Cabal Therapy, and Dread Return, the deck aims to bring back powerful creatures like Ox of Agonas and Thassa's Oracle from the graveyard to win the game. Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba also play a crucial role in generating zombie tokens to overwhelm the opponent. The deck is designed to quickly combo off and win the game through graveyard manipulation and explosive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent while hindering their game plan. By using cards like Swords to Plowshares, Force of Will, and disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient deployment of creatures, while cards like Solitude and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional versatility and protection.

This deck focuses on generating a high storm count to win the game using Tendrils of Agony as a finisher. It utilizes fast mana and card selection to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to generate a lethal storm count. The deck includes various tutors and discard spells to dig through the deck and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Song of Creation provides additional card draw to help find key pieces, while Burning Wish offers additional versatility and utility in finding silver bullets from the sideboard. The goal is to efficiently execute the combo and win the game in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Wasteland, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent, Orcish Bowmasters, and Barrowgoyf. It utilizes countermagic like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats, and removal spells like Fatal Push to control the board. The deck also has a strong card advantage engine with cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The goal is to maintain tempo and control the game while chipping away at the opponent's life total until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting opponents with counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Teferi to generate card advantage and protect its own threats. The inclusion of cards like Back to Basics and Dress Down gives the deck additional ways to disrupt opponents' strategies and solidify its control over the game. With a balanced mix of removal, counterspells, card selection, and threats, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through attrition and incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces needed to quickly bring out powerful artifacts like Coveted Jewel, The One Ring, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn through cards like Transmute Artifact and Show and Tell. Utilizing powerful mana accelerants like Ancient Tomb and Grim Monolith, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state and potentially win the game in just a few turns. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan, making it a potent and versatile strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to aggressively ramp up mana with cards like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, while using powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes Chalice of the Void to lock down opponents' spells, and cards like Glaring Fleshraker to pressure opponents and close out games quickly. Eye of Ugin can help tutor for key Eldrazi creatures, while cards like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths provide additional late-game threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and disruptive Eldrazi creatures.

The deck revolves around using aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Cori-Steel Cutter to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Force of Will to control the board and protect its threats. The deck's key strategy is to efficiently use low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to maintain tempo and outpace the opponent, while also utilizing card draw and selection with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure a consistent flow of threats.

Utilizing disruptive spells and efficient creatures, the deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game, pressuring the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck features powerful cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Murktide Regent, supported by spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Fatal Push to maintain control. With a focus on resource denial and disruptive tactics, the deck looks to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through careful manipulation of the game state.

The deck focuses on using a combination of spells like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly cast a powerful card like Doomsday, which allows the player to rearrange their deck in a specific order to win the game by using Thassa's Oracle to draw a card and win the game if there are no cards left in the library. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. It aims to assemble the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible to secure a win.
